intro: Halimolobos boelckei, commonly known as the Boelcke's halimolobos, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
